items.title: China’s Vivo unveils robotics lab, mixed reality headset
items.summary:
- Vivo presented innovations in robotics and mixed reality technology at the [Boao Forum for Asia Annual Conference 2025](https://www.techinasia.com/news/chinas-vivo-unveils-robotics-lab-mixed-reality-headset) on Mar. 25.
- The company established a robotics laboratory for developing consumer and home robotics technology using AI, imaging technologies, and spatial computing.
- Vivo unveiled a mixed reality headset named the Vivo Vision.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Israel’s startups
Alipay+ goes live in Sri Lanka
items.summary:
- Ant International and LankaPay launch cross-border mobile payments via the LankaQR network.
- 14 international payment apps under Alipay+ can be used at over 400,000 Sri Lankan merchants.
- Travelers from 10 countries, including China, South Korea, and Italy, can use their digital wallets to pay by scanning QR codes.
- The initiative aims to simplify payments for tourists and boost local business.
- Partner apps include Alipay, GCash, and Naver Pay, among others.
- The LankaQR network was introduced by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in 2020 for QR-based transaction interoperability.

items.title: Amazon tests AI tools for shopping, health assistance
items.summary:
- Amazon is currently testing AI tools to enhance shopping experiences.
- The tools may also assist customers in health-related queries.
- This initiative aims to leverage AI for improving customer service and engagement.

items.title: Grab Indonesia launches new feature for easier bill payments
items.summary:
- Grab Indonesia has introduced a new feature to streamline the bill payment process for users.
- The feature aims to enhance user experience by making it more convenient to pay bills through the app.
- This initiative is part of Grab's ongoing efforts to expand its financial services in the region.

items.title: Bain Capital acquires majority stake in Italian software firm
items.summary:
- Bain Capital is acquiring a majority stake in Italian software company Namirial SpA from Ambienta.
- The deal values Namirial at €1.1 billion (US$1.2 billion).
- Namirial's founder and CEO, along with the management, will retain a significant stake in the company.
- The transaction will be officially announced this week.

items.title: BharatPe hits EBITDA breakeven, cuts losses in FY25
items.summary:
- BharatPe reported EBITDA breakeven for the first nine months of FY25.
- Consolidated net loss improved to 149 crore rupee (US$17.37 million) from 492 crore rupee (US$57.37 million) in FY24.
- The company's NBFC arm, Trillion Loans Fintech, made a profit of 29.7 crore rupee (US$3.46 million).
- Revenue grew 182% in FY23, reaching 1,029 crore rupee (US$119.99 million) under interim CEO Nalin Negi.
- The financial turnaround followed internal disputes involving former MD Ashneer Grover.

items.title: US AI fintech Sympera AI secures $10m seed funding
items.author: David Sosna, Daniel Gordon
items.summary:
- Sympera AI, a fintech startup, raised US$10 million in seed funding led by Nyca Partners and Viola Ventures.
- The company aims to improve relationship banking for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) using AI.
- The platform uses AI agents to assist relationship managers in identifying business opportunities for SMBs, addressing inefficiencies in resource allocation.
- SMBs contribute approximately US$150 billion annually to US banking revenue.
- The funding reflects growing interest in AI-driven financial solutions as banks work to enhance efficiency and personalize client interactions.

items.title: WeLab banks on SEA for growth
items.author: Miguel
items.summary:
- WeLab Bank is expanding into the Philippines, Malaysia, and Vietnam after achieving monthly breakeven in December 2024.
- The bank aims for profitability in Indonesia and Thailand within three to five years.
- Founder Simon Loong reflects on the irony of returning to banking after leaving a traditional bank.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s SaaS startups?
items.summary:
- Overview of active investors in Southeast Asia's software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector.
- Features an updated list of investors that backed region's SaaS startups in the last two years.
- Focuses on firms that have invested in three or more companies within the specified timeframe.

items.title: Grab seeks $2b loan for potential GoTo acquisition, sources say
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Ltd. is in discussions for a loan of up to US$2 billion to acquire GoTo Group Inc.
- The proposed bridge loan would have a term of about 12 months.
- Talks are in early stages, details may evolve. 
- Grab is also considering other financing options, such as bonds or equity, depending on the acquisition's success.

items.title: Chinese bubble tea chain Chagee files for US IPO
items.summary:
- Chagee, a Chinese bubble tea chain, has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States.
- The company aims to list on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol “CHA,” with its filing submitted on Mar. 25.
- Chagee plans to open its first US store this spring at the Westfield Century City mall in Los Angeles.
- In its regulatory filing, Chagee reported a net income of US$344.5 million and revenue of US$1.7 billion for 2024.

items.title: Australian authors outraged over Meta’s AI using their books
items.summary:
- Australian authors express anger over alleged use of their works in Meta's AI training dataset, LibGen.
- Authors like Ta-Nehisi Coates and Sarah Silverman are involved in lawsuits against Meta for copyright infringement.
- The Atlantic offers a searchable database for authors to check if their works are in LibGen.
- Advocates, including Holden Sheppard and Tracey Spicer, call for legal action and government intervention.
- The Australian Society of Authors encourages affected writers to voice their concerns, while Meta remains silent on the issue.

items.title: D2C beauty brand Pilgrim’s revenue surges 160% in FY24
items.author: Anurag Kedia, Gagandeep Makker
items.summary:
- Heavenly Secrets Pvt Ltd reported a 160% increase in operating revenue for FY24.
- Revenue climbed to 198.8 crore rupees (US$23.3 million) from 76.5 crore rupees (US$8.9 million).
- Pilgrim, founded in 2019, offers various beauty and body care items and has expanded offline with five retail stores and partnerships with 300 stores across India.

items.title: Gobi Partners invests in Malaysian chip design firm SkyeChip
items.author: Fong Swee Kiang, Teh Chee Hak
items.summary:
- Gobi Partners has invested in SkyeChip, a Malaysian semiconductor IC design company.
- The funding is sourced from the Khazanah Nasional-backed Gobi Dana Impak Fund and Gobi’s regional funds.
- The investment will support SkyeChip in talent acquisition, business expansion, and working capital.
- SkyeChip specializes in silicon intellectual property (IP) and custom ASICs, targeting applications in AI and HPC.

items.title: Tencent backs Chinese robotics firm Agibot in funding round
items.summary:
- Tencent has invested in the Chinese robotics firm Agibot during a recent funding round.
- The investment aims to boost Agibot's technological advancements in robotics.
- Agibot focuses on developing innovative robotics solutions for various industries.

items.title: US video game retailer GameStop adopts bitcoin as reserve asset
items.summary:
- GameStop has adopted bitcoin as a treasury reserve asset, unanimously approved by its board.
- The company will use part of its cash or future debt and equity issuances for the investment, but the maximum amount has not been disclosed.
- This decision follows an executive order by US President Trump to establish a strategic reserve of cryptocurrencies using government-held tokens.
- GameStop reported a rise in fourth-quarter net income to US$131.3 million, up from US$63.1 million last year, due to cost reductions and stronger sales performance.
- Following the announcement, GameStop shares rose 6.2% in extended trading.

items.title: Building bridges with TIA marketers Benita and Yessi
items.author: Benita Vania, Yessi Nurita Labas
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia focuses on building and serving Asia’s tech and startup community through events and content.
- Benita and Yessi work on marketing strategies to connect with readers through various channels including social media.
- Benita transitioned from a research role to marketing, focusing on event ticket sales and partnership content, while Yessi developed her storytelling skills at a national newspaper.
- Both emphasize the importance of creating content that resonates with the audience and building ongoing relationships with users.
- They find personal growth through their roles, with Yessi learning to manage her time better and Benita exploring entrepreneurial projects, including a music box company.
- Upcoming initiatives include reaching out to the general business community after partnering with The Business Times.

items.title: India to abolish 6% digital levy on online services
items.summary:
- India plans to abolish a 6% equalisation levy on online services, including advertising, as part of amendments to the Finance Bill 2025.
- This levy has affected US tech companies such as Google, Meta, and Amazon.
- The amendment is expected to pass in parliament this week, amid US concerns and threats of trade sanctions starting Apr. 2.
- The removal of the levy aims to ease trade tensions between India and the US as stated by tax expert Amit Maheshwari.

items.title: Chocolate Finance aims for normalcy after $374m in withdrawals
items.author: Walter de Oude
items.summary:
- Chocolate Finance experienced net withdrawals of around S$500 million (US$374 million) over two weeks, reducing AUM by 40%.
- CEO Walter de Oude claims the situation was not a meltdown and praised the firm's automated handling of withdrawals.
- The issues arose partly due to the decision to end transactions with AXS, leading to customer frustrations and a withdrawal surge.
- De Oude acknowledged the company's communication regarding the AXS decision was poorly managed, contributing to customer exits.

items.title: Kuaishou’s Q4 revenue growth slows to 8.7%: report
items.summary:
- Kuaishou Technology reports its slowest quarterly sales growth since its public listing in 2021.
- In Q4 2024, revenue rose by 8.7% to 35.4 billion yuan (US$4.9 billion), below market expectations of 35.7 billion yuan (US$5 billion).
- AI models have increased user engagement and marketing spending, averaging over 30 million yuan (US$4.1 million) daily.
- Analysts highlight challenges including economic pressures, rising R&D costs, and tougher competition in ecommerce.
- Recent developments include Kuaishou’s Kling AI integrating DeepSeek for enhanced video content creation tools on 20-Mar-2025.

items.title: Ripple resolves SEC lawsuit, ending four-year dispute
items.author: Stuart Alderoty
items.summary:
- Ripple and SEC announced the end of their four-year legal dispute on Mar. 25.
- Ripple will withdraw its cross-appeal; SEC retains $50 million of a $125 million fine.
- Remaining balance returned to Ripple; SEC requests lifting of current injunction.
- Legal battle began in December 2020 following SEC's accusations of unregistered securities offering via XRP.

items.title: Ola Electric settles dispute with Rosmerta, petition withdrawn
items.summary:
- Ola Electric Technologies has settled a dispute with Rosmerta Group, paying ₹26.75 crore (US$3.12 million).
- The payment led to the withdrawal of insolvency petitions filed against Ola Electric.
- The insolvency petition was filed for allegedly defaulting on service payment claims by Rosmerta Group, aimed at initiating insolvency resolution.

items.title: Starlink moves closer to India launch
items.summary:
[Starlink has received regulatory approval to provide services in India.]
[The service will initially offer satellite-based internet access in specific regions.]
[Launch details and service pricing are yet to be disclosed.]
[This move is part of Starlink's expansion strategy in the Asia-Pacific region.]

items.title: India’s Zypp Electric cuts workforce by 10% ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- Zypp Electric has reduced its workforce by nearly 10% in preparation for an IPO by the end of 2026.
- The workforce decreased from approximately 1,300 in January to about 1,180-1,190.
- CEO Akash Gupta stated the layoffs were due to performance issues and aimed at improving efficiency for sustainable growth.
- The company targets EBITDA profitability before listing.

items.title: Israeli media firm RGE launches VC fund for media, content startups
items.author: Tal Gilor
items.summary:
- RGE has launched RGE Ventures, a VC fund investing in 3 to 5 content and media startups annually.
- Each investment will reach hundreds of thousands of dollars.
- The fund will be led by Tal Gilor, a former partner at Labs/02.
- RGE Ventures aims to support innovation in AI for media and new content monetization models.
- Startups will have access to RGE’s infrastructure for testing and development, along with professional guidance.

items.title: Indian healthtech startup Dozee bags $8.3m
items.author: Mudit Dandwate, Gaurav Parchani
items.summary:
- Dozee has raised ₹71.5 crore (US$8.3 million) through equity and debt funding.
- Funding sources include US$735,689 from Temasek Trust’s C3H and US$6.8 million in debt from Stockhausen International.
- Founded in 2015, Dozee specializes in contactless patient monitoring systems for vital signs and health deterioration alerts.
- The company has expanded to international markets, including the US, UAE, and Africa, and aims to further broaden its product offerings.

items.title: Microsoft unveils AI tools for research, data analysis
items.summary:
- Microsoft is launching two AI-driven tools, Researcher and Analyst, as part of its Microsoft 365 Copilot platform.
- Available to customers in the Frontier program starting in April 2025.
- Researcher uses OpenAI’s deep research model to assist with market strategies and client reports, integrating data from platforms like Confluence, ServiceNow, and Salesforce.
- Analyst is based on OpenAI’s o3-mini reasoning model, designed for advanced data analysis.

items.title: PhonePe launches vehicle insurance, expand offerings
items.summary:
- PhonePe launches vehicle insurance for two-wheelers and four-wheelers through its app.
- Users can compare and purchase policies directly via the PhonePe platform.
- The company, which obtained an insurance broking license in 2021, previously offered life, health, and travel insurance.
- Potential savings are noted: up to ₹4,000 on two-wheeler insurance and ₹40,000 on four-wheeler insurance.
- This launch coincides with preparations for PhonePe's IPO, following a reported profit of ₹197 crore for FY 2023-24.
- PhonePe maintains over 48% market share in India's UPI sector as of January 2025.

items.title: AI healthtech firm Navina nets $55m series C
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Israel-based AI clinical intelligence provider Navina raised $55 million in a Series C funding round.
- The investment, led by Growth Equity at Goldman Sachs Alternatives, increases total funding to $100 million.
- Existing investors such as Vertex Ventures Israel and Grove Ventures participated in this round.
- Funds will enhance AI technology, automate workflows, and expand point-of-care interventions.
- Founded in 2018 by Ronen Lavi and Shay Perera, Navina’s platform serves over 10,000 healthcare professionals in 1,300 clinics.

items.title: Taobao could be the ace up Alibaba’s sleeve
items.summary:
- Alibaba merged its local and international ecommerce businesses in November 2024, focusing on Taobao as a key asset.
- Taobao, launched in the early 2000s, aims to expand into Southeast Asia, beginning with markets like Singapore and Malaysia.
- The platform recently introduced an English-language app and provisions for free shipping on apparel to enhance user experience for overseas shoppers.

items.title: Shopee drops J&T Express’ standard, economy deliveries in Indonesia (update)
items.summary:
- Shopee will discontinue standard and economy delivery services from [J&T Express](https://jet.co.id/) in Indonesia starting April.
- Change communicated to sellers since March for operational preparedness.
- Other logistics partners, including JNE and Pos Indonesia, remain available for delivery on Shopee.
- J&T Cargo services for larger parcels will still be available.
- Indonesia is a key market for J&T, with 4 million packages delivered daily.

items.title: US tech firm Infinite Reality acquires file sharing app Napster
items.summary:
- Napster has been acquired by Infinite Reality for US$207 million.
- Acquisition announced on Mar. 25, marking a new chapter for the digital music-sharing platform.
- Infinite Reality aims to integrate Napster into metaverse initiatives, creating virtual spaces for concerts and listening parties.
- CEO John Acunto emphasizes the goal of building interactive, music-centered community spaces.
- Napster, launched in 1999, was the first major peer-to-peer file-sharing platform for MP3 music files.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s AI startups?
Quick commerce startup Apna Mart raises $25m
items.author: Abhishek Singh, Chetan Garg
items.summary:
- Apna Mart is raising ₹214.3 crore (US$25 million) in a funding round led by Fundamentum Partnership.
- Participation includes existing investors Peak XV Partners and Sparrow Capital, along with new investor Accel India.
- Founded in 2022, Apna Mart specializes in delivering groceries in 15 minutes in Tier II and III cities.
- Operates through a franchise outlet model, differentiating from competitors who use dark stores.

items.title: Unitree has been profitable since 2020, early investor says
items.author: Zhao Nan
items.summary:
- Unitree, a leading robotics startup in China, has been profitable every year since 2020.
- Zhao Nan, founder of SevenUp Capital, revealed this during a conversation with Unitree's CEO, Wang Xingxing.
- The company has no current plans to raise new capital due to its sustained profitability.
- Founded in 2016, Unitree specializes in quadruped robots for various sectors including industrial and entertainment.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm Charm Security bags $8m seed funding
items.author: Roy Zur, Avichai Ben
items.summary:
• Israeli cybersecurity startup Charm Security has received US$8 million in seed funding, led by Team8.
• Founded by CEO Roy Zur and CTO Avichai Ben, the company specializes in combating AI-driven financial scams.
• Charm Security's platform uses AI to target social engineering fraud by analyzing human vulnerability patterns.
• AI-generated scams caused over US$1 trillion in financial losses in 2023, prompting regulators to consider new liability rules for banks.
• The funding will be utilized for team expansion, product development, and partnerships to enhance fraud prevention.

items.title: Chinese embodied AI startup TARS raises $120m in angel funding
items.summary:
- TARS, a Chinese AI startup, raised $120 million in an angel funding round for embodied AI development.
- Funding was co-led by Lanchi Ventures and Qiming Venture Partners, with participation from Linear Venture, Hengxu Capital, Aplus Capital, and others.
- Founded in February 2025 in Shanghai, TARS aims to use funds for research, AI model training, and technology applications expansion.

items.title: Otter.ai launches AI agents for meetings, sales, demos
items.summary:
- Otter.ai has launched three new AI agents for meetings and calls.
- The Otter Meeting Agent can answer questions using company data, schedule meetings, and draft emails via voice interactions.
- Currently available on Zoom, it will soon expand to Microsoft Teams and Google Meet.
- Enhances existing AI meeting assistant with natural voice commands and database-driven responses.

items.title: BMW partners with Alibaba to bring AI to China cars
items.summary:
- BMW Group partners with Alibaba to develop an AI engine for next-generation vehicles in China.
- Collaboration will utilize Alibaba's Tongyi Qianwen models and Banma in-car AI platform for enhanced smart cockpit features.
- The AI engine will debut in the Neue Klasse series in 2026, featuring improved voice interactions and in-car mobility services, to be showcased at the Shanghai Auto Show in April 2025.

items.title: India orders Samsung to pay $610m in back taxes
items.summary:
- India has ordered Samsung to pay US$601 million in back taxes and penalties for tariff violations on telecom equipment imports.
- Samsung allegedly misclassified “Remote Radio Head” components from 2018 to 2021 to evade tariffs, leading to no duties paid on US$784 million worth of imports.
- Seven executives, including VP Sung Beam Hong and CFO Dong Won Chu, face additional fines of US$81 million.
- The investigation, initiated in 2021, involved raids at Samsung's offices in Mumbai and Gurugram, where evidence was seized.
- Samsung denies wrongdoing, asserting compliance with Indian laws regarding customs classification.

items.title: Shareholders approve XL Axiata, Smartfren merger
items.summary:
- On Mar. 25, shareholders of XL Axiata, Smartfren Telecom, and Smart Telcom approved the merger.
- The merger has received regulatory approvals from various Indonesian authorities.
- It will create a new entity, XLSmart, serving over 94.3 million subscribers.
- XLSmart is projected to generate annual revenue of 45.8 trillion rupiah (US$2.76 billion) with an EBITDA of 22.5 trillion rupiah (US$1.35 billion).
- Axiata Group and Sinar Mas will each hold a 34.8% stake, overseeing the company's direction.
- Rajeev Sethi appointed as President Director and CEO of XLSmart.

items.title: Agritech startup Grow Indigo secures $10m
items.summary:
- Agritech startup Grow Indigo raised US$10 million from British International Investment (BII).
- The funds will enhance sustainability programs and expand carbon farming initiatives.
- Founded in 2018 as a joint venture between US-based Indigo Ag and Mahyco, Grow Indigo focuses on sustainable agricultural solutions to improve farmers’ income and minimize resource wastage.

items.title: Cisco, Nvidia launch AI factory for enterprise security
items.summary:
- Cisco and Nvidia have partnered to create an AI factory geared towards enhancing enterprise security.
- The initiative aims to integrate advanced AI technologies into enterprise security solutions.
- This collaboration is expected to address increasing cybersecurity threats for businesses globally.

items.title: OpenAI adds photorealistic image generation to GPT-4o
items.summary:
- OpenAI has integrated image generation into GPT-4o, providing photorealistic visuals and multimodal outputs.
- The model effectively understands the relationship between images and language for accurate visual generation.
- Trained on a combined dataset of images and text, it generates contextually appropriate visuals and can render text in images for logos and diagrams.
- Utilizing transformer architecture and diffusion techniques, OpenAI enhances pixel-level precision for practical image generation.

items.title: Ex-Meta exec’s Israeli cybersecurity startup secures $55m
items.author: Roi Tiger, Pini Pinhasov, Ophir Arie, Omer Singer
items.summary:
- Roi Tiger's stealth-mode cybersecurity startup raises US$55 million, valuing the company at US$400 million.
- Funding is led by Greenoaks, following a US$20 million seed round with Sequoia, Index Ventures, and Cyberstarts.
- Tiger is a former Meta executive; co-founders have relevant cybersecurity experience from companies like Medigate and Snowflake.

items.title: Dell cuts workforce by 10%, faces AI cost challenges
items.summary:
- Dell Technologies reported a 10% decline in its workforce for fiscal 2025, bringing headcount down to approximately 108,000.
- This reduction is part of cost-cutting measures, including limited external hiring and role reorganization.
- Dell expects challenges in its adjusted gross margin rate for fiscal 2026 due to rising costs of building AI servers in a competitive market.

items.title: Indian lab-grown diamond brand Firefly nets $3m seed funding
items.summary:
- Firefly Diamonds, an Indian lab-grown diamond jewellery brand, raised $3 million in seed funding led by WestBridge Capital.
- The funding will go towards retail expansion, enhancing digital presence, and R&D for new jewellery collections.
- Currently operates stores in Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad, with plans to expand to over 20 locations within two years.

items.title: ID minister to summon ride-hailing firms over $3 Eid bonus complaints
items.author: Yassierli
items.summary:
- Indonesian Minister of Manpower Yassierli plans to summon ride-hailing companies regarding Eid al-Fitr bonus discrepancies.
- Complaints reported bonuses as low as 50,000 rupiah (US$3) for drivers.
- Issues raised by the Indonesian Transportation Workers Union (SPAI), indicating minimal bonuses relative to annual earnings.
- Yassierli announced on Mar. 25 that the ministry will investigate the matter before Eid al-Fitr.

items.title: BYD surpasses Tesla with $101b in 2024 revenue
items.summary:
- BYD reported a 29% increase in its annual revenue for 2024, reaching approximately US$101.1 billion.
- This revenue exceeds Tesla's revenue of US$97.7 billion for the same period.
- BYD began surpassing Tesla in sales from Q3 2024 and has led in unit deliveries since 2022, driven by strong demand and government subsidies in China.
